title: 110_hr4044
content: The Act is titled the "National Guard and Reservists Debt Relief Act of 2008" and includes amendments. Section 707(b)(2)(D) of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include provisions for disabled veterans and debt relief during active duty. The text discusses provisions for disabled veterans and debt relief during active duty, including requirements for performing homeland defense activities for a specified period of time. The text discusses provisions for disabled veterans and debt relief during active duty, including requirements for performing homeland defense activities for a specified period of time. SEC. 3. GAO STUDY. The Comptroller General will conduct a study on the use and effects of provisions amended by the Act, focusing on reserve component members' utilization of benefits, their debt status related to service, and their involvement in cases under title 11 of the United States Code. The Comptroller General will conduct a study on the effects of provisions amended by the Act on reserve component members' debt status related to service and their involvement in cases under title 11 of the United States Code. Factors for determining the relevance of a case to a member's service include the percentage of debts incurred as a result of such service. The study will analyze the impact of provisions amended by the Act on reserve component members' debt status related to service in cases under title 11 of the United States Code. The term "effects" refers to the number of cases, aggregate debt amount, and debt incurred as a result of service. The study will analyze the impact of provisions amended by the Act on reserve component members' debt status related to service in cases under title 11 of the United States Code. It will examine the aggregate amount of debt discharged in chapter 7 cases, debt in chapter 7 cases converted to chapter 13, resources expended by bankruptcy courts and trustees, and any indications of abuse. The study will analyze the impact of provisions amended by the Act on reserve component members' debt status related to service in cases under title 11 of the United States Code, including any increase in debt levels, changes in debt-incurrence practices, and indications of abuse. The Act and its amendments will take effect 60 days after enactment, with application limited to cases under title 11 of the United States Code in a 3-year period.
